revised_title: John Jacob Fox's Contributions to Chemistry and Spectroscopy
tldr: John Jacob Fox was a chemist who worked in the Government Laboratory and made significant contributions to organic chemistry, absorption spectra, and analytical chemistry. He conducted research on hydroxyazo-compounds, the ultra-violet absorption spectra of alkaloids, and the analysis of paints. Fox also worked on the Safeguarding of Industries Act, pollution of rivers, and the restoration of wall paintings in historical buildings. His expertise in chemistry and spectroscopy led to numerous publications and a successful career in the field.
